alert.note: Alert for Cooper; Henry; Howard; Johnson; Pettis; Randolph; Saline (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:13AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, eastern Henry, Pettis, Howard, southeastern Saline, Cooper and southeastern Johnson Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 313 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Calhoun, or 11 miles east of Clinton, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedalia, Clinton, Boonville, Windsor, Fayette, Glasgow, New Franklin, Pilot Grove, Smithton, Green Ridge, Calhoun, Otterville, Deepwater, Bunceton, Armstrong, Prairie Home, Coal, Nelson, Hughesville and Blackwater. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 73 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central, north central and west central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Cooper; Henry; Howard; Johnson; Pettis; Randolph; Saline
